Comment: I had never heard of him before now, but I'm so impressed by what he did. Talk about going the extra mile for your constituents... he traveled a lot of miles!  What impressed me the most is that he took that trip without a guarantee of a result. So there was a risk that he'd take the trip and nothing would result from it, which would open him up to criticism of "That whole trip was pointless!" That's what almost happened, actually. He tried to get a meeting with Abrego Garcia and was rejected, even for a phone call! Then he tried again for a second day and was rejected again, and was about to go home. Then things changed at the last minute.  Van Hollen was Abrego Garcia's only point of contact with the outside world in over a month. That is absolutely awful, but still, at least he had one point of contact instead of zero!! And it was amazing to see that he was alive, since there was no proof of life before then.  Other members of Congress should follow Van Hollen's example and keep fighting for Abrego Garcia and all the other people who were sent to El Salvador without due process.
